content: instructions p 1 gingham heart placemat size 14 x 10 5 weight 4 yarn with 4mm hook yarn color a 100 yds color b 75 yds abbreviations us terms *there is a full stitch key with video tutorial links for each stitch used in this pattern located at the end of this instructions packet i have a facebook group dedicated to answering questions about my patterns and building community and many tutorials on my youtube channel join me https //linktr ee/heathernobledesigns **this pattern was designed by heather noble** please do not share copy or distribute this pattern you may sell your finished projects please tag me in any photos of your projects that you post online @heathernobledesigns ©2024 heather noble designs instructions p 2 mosaic crochet basics all work is done on the front side of the work do not turn alternate colors every row all single_crochet stitches are worked into the back loops of same row scblo all double_crochet stitches are worked into the corresponding front loop 2 row below dcflo ©2024 heather noble designs instructions p 3 getting started first 2 row the charts are numbered from left to right for layout purposes but crochet charts are read from right to left unless you are a left-handed crocheter there is a red arrow on chart p 2 to show you where to start your project here is an example of how to lay out your charts i have included both a written pattern and charts for this design p 1 p 2 row 1 foundation row - color a make an i-cord foundation chain of 65 chain 1 single_crochet under both loops of each i-cord st across 65 row 2 - color b starting in row 2 each row begins and ends with a border stitch bs bs scblo 63 bs ©2024 heather noble designs instructions p 4 how to read the chart the following 2 pages use my d nealian font lower case a pattern as a sample to illustrate how to read the charts this is not the actual pattern-it is for instructional purposes to illustrate beginning mosaic crochet concepts row 1 example row 1 of this example pattern is the blue row of single_crochet in back loops only notice that even though the shading of the pattern changes to show what the final product will look like…row 1 is entirely empty boxes all the way across that means single_crochet into every stitch each row alternates colors color a is the color of the design ©2024 heather noble designs instructions p 5 row 2 example cut your yarn at the end of each row and join with your new color at the beginning of the next in row 2 color b the x means double_crochet into the front loop of the corresponding stitch 2 row below and the means single_crochet into back loop of the current row work the row from right to left double_crochet 5 single_crochet 4 double_crochet 4 single_crochet 4 double_crochet 3 row 3
